IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO ESTABLISH A CONTINUUM OF CARE TO PROVIDE CHRIST-LIKE HEALING TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATION, TREATMENT, AND HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE CHRIST-LIKE HEALING TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATION, TREATMENT AND HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.Description: ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. PROVIDES MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL SERVICES FOR ENTITIES WITHIN ITS SYSTEM. ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE INC. ALSO COORDINATES CURRENT AND PLANNED HEALTH RELATED ACTIVITIES. IN THE COMMUNITY, ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE INC. IS OPERATED FOR THE BENEFIT OF AND TO CARRY OUT THE PURPOSE OF ST BERNARDS MEDICAL CENTER.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE C, PART II-B, LINE 1I
Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THIS AMOUNT IS A PERCENTAGE OF DUES PAID TO VARIOUS PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATIONS ALLOCABLE TO LOBBYING EXPENSES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COMPANY AND CERTAIN SUBSIDIARIES, AS INDICATED ABOVE, ARE EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND A SIMILAR PROVISION OF STATE LAW. HOWEVER, THE COMPANY AND THE SUBSIDIARIES ARE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX ON ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME. SOME OF THE COMPANY'S SUBSIDIARIES ARE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX. DURING 2010 AND 2009, THESE ENTITIES HAD NET OPERATING LOSSES AND INCURRED NO TAX LIABILITY. OTHER OF THE COMPANY'S SUBSIDIARIES ARE ORGANIZED AS ARKANSAS LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES AND ARE NOT DIRECTLY SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND APPLICABLE STATE LAWS. THEREFORE, TAXABLE INCOME OR LOSS IS REPORTED TO THE INDIVIDUAL PARTNERS FOR INCLUSION IN THEIR RESPECTIVE TAX RETURNS AND NO PROVISION FOR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COMPANY ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF ASC TOPIC 740 (ASC 740), ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES, ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2010. NO AMOUNTS WERE RECORDED AS A RESULT OF THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ASC 740.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. IS NOT IN THE PRACTICE OF GRANTING FUNDS ON A REGULAR BASIS. THE GIFT TO FOOD BANK OF NE AR WAS A RARE ONE-TIME GIFT. THEREFORE, THE MONITORING OF THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS NOT NECESSARY.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 6
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: EVERY EMPLOYEE OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. RECEIVED A NET BONUS OF $250 DURING THE TAX YEAR. APPROXIMATELY $100 OF THIS BONUS WAS BASED ON THE NET MARGIN PERCENT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 1B
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS CONSIDERING A WRITTEN POLICY REGARDING PAYMENT OR REIMBURSEMENT OF THE EXPENSES ON SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 1A.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SINCE 1900, ST BERNARDS HAS SERVED AS OUR COMMUNITY'S TRUSTED PROVIDER OF COMPREHENSIVE, COMPASSIONATE HEALTHCARE. WITH OUR DEDICATED AND EXPERIENCED EMPLOYEES, ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY, AND THE LARGEST MEDICAL STAFF IN THE REGION, ST BERNARDS IS THE MEDICAL CENTER OF CHOICE. TODAY, AS WELL AS IN THE FUTURE, ST BERNARDS WILL CONTINUE TO PUT PATIENTS AND COMMUNITY NEEDS FIRST BY FOCUSING ON QUALITY, SAFETY, COST CONTROL, SERVICE AND DIVERSITY. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2010, $23,183,592 WAS SPENT FOR COMMUNITY BENEFIT. 254,704 PERSONS WERE SERVED THROUGH HEALTH SCREENINGS, DONATIONS, EDUCATIONAL CLASSES, AND VOLUNTEER EFFORTS.

OLIVETAN BENEDICTINE SISTERS, INC IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. THE DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION SHALL AT ALL TIMES INCLUDE SEVEN MEMBERS OF THE MEMBER. OF THESE SEVEN MEMBERS ONE SHALL BE THE PRIORESS OF HOLY ANGELS CONVENT AND ONE SHALL BE THE MEMBER SERVING AS BUSINESS MANAGER OF THE MEMBER. THE MEMBER MUST APPROVE ANY TRANSACTION OVER $1 MILLION. THE DIOCESE OF LITTLE ROCK MUST APPROVE ANY TRANSACTION OVER $5 MILLION. THE MEMBER ALSO RESERVES POWER OVER ANY VARIANCE WITH CONGREGATIONAL POLICY, PHILOSOPHY, OR ETHICS. ANY AMENDMENT, ALTERATION, OR REPEAL OF THE BYLAWS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE MEMBER. THE MEMBER ALSO RESERVES POWER TO REMOVE ANY MEMBER OF THE GOVERNING BOARD IF IN THE SOLE DISCRETION OF THE MEMBER THE GOVERNING BOARD MEMBER ACTS AT VARIANCE WITH CONGREGATIONAL POLICY, PHILOSOPHY, OR THE ETHICS OF THE MEMBER.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE FOLLOWING PERSONS OR GROUPS: CONTROLLER OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC., VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC., PRESIDENT/CEO OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC., LEGAL COUNSEL, AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. PRIOR TO FILING.

DIRECTORS AND ABOVE ANNUALLY SUBMIT A WRITTEN STATEMENT DISCLOSING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. MANAGEMENT INVESTIGATES ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS AND TAKES APPROPRIATE ACTION DEPENDING ON THE NATURE OF THE CONFLICT. LEGAL COUNSEL ALSO REVIEWS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND ADVISES MANAGEMENT.

THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SELECTS PERSONS TO SERVE ON THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE APPROVES THE INITIAL SALARY AND ANY SUBSEQUENT SALARY ADJUSTMENTS OF ALL MANAGEMENT. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OBTAINS AN INDEPENDENT SALARY SURVEY FROM CLARK CONSULTING ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FOR USE IN DETERMINING THE APPROPRIATE SALARY RANGES FOR MANAGEMENT. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE PRESENTS THE INFORMATION TO THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL. IN 2009, COMPENSATION OF ALL MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION WAS REVIEWED BY CLARK CONSULTING.

ST. BERNARDS HEALTHCARE, INC. IS IN THE PROCESS OF IMPLEMENTING A POLICY TO EVALUATE ITS PARTICIPATION IN JOINT VENTURE ARRANGEMENTS. ALL OPERATING AGREEMENTS OF JOINT VENTURE ARRANGEMENTS CONTAIN A CLAUSE THAT SAFEGUARDS THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT STATUS.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

NameOfRelatedOrg.BusinessNameLine1: HEART SURGERY ASSOCIATES OF AR INC
